meanings.definition: The quality or state of being a thing.
meanings.sent1: The thingness of the rock was undeniable.
meanings.sent2: She pondered the thingness of existence.
meanings.sent3: The thingness of the situation made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His thingness as a leader shone through in times of crisis.
meanings.sent5: The thingness of the forest enveloped her senses.

meanings.definition: The essence or nature of something.
meanings.sent1: The thingness of her smile brightened the room.
meanings.sent2: He captured the thingness of the melody in his composition.
meanings.sent3: The thingness of his jokes always brought joy to others.
meanings.sent4: In her eyes, the thingness of love was pure and true.
meanings.sent5: The thingness of the sunset painted the sky with beauty.

meanings.sent1: The thingness of the book was heavy in her hands.
meanings.sent2: He admired the thingness of the antique vase.
meanings.sent3: The thingness of the cake tempted her sweet tooth.
meanings.sent4: The thingness of the mountain loomed large in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The thingness of the puppy brought joy to the family.
